page.title: 09West Tytherley Stud Farm
page.content: In West Tytherley there is a Stud Farm owned by Mr.J.Coggan.There are sixteen well bred brood mares and nine foals. The brood mares are sent abroad to stallions to France or even America. The brood mares here are Thoroughbred. The foals are sold when they are yearlings.They are sold at{NEWMARKET} and put in special paddocks with NO barbed wire.In 1954 one of the foals from this Stud went for {Â£23,000}but was soon exceeded by {Â£30,000}.The yearlings are given their names with new owners .The foals are born between May and September.In this Stud they have forty-two loose boxes but most of the horses stay out.They have five liveries there.He also trains dogs for shows such as One Man And His Dog.It takes over two years to train a sheep dog.He trained the winner one year.
